intro: Amylotheca stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled amylotheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color and bloom during the cooler months. Amylotheca stenopetala is often found in sandy soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
